PLEASE Gaben. Give us the finale. BTW if you haven't yet played HF2 you OWE IT TO YOURSELF to give the time and play it. Trust me, one of the best games in the world.

As expected from Valve, its a really good game. Gameplay is great, the scene is great. While theres no cutscene, i prefer not to when it comes to Valve because it gives us players a feeling to react just by looking and/or controlling when that scene happens. Though this is much more intense than the original, and sometimes it gets you the feeling you just stepped into a war. They added new stuff such as the meter which shows your oxygen, sprint, and flashlight. When its empty your character can either not sprint, lose air underwater, or flashlight is off. It can be all, and if used both things it wastes quicker.

The music is also good, giving us the feeling from the gameplay.

Not sure if theres anything i should point out, besides this is Valve we're talking about. The game is really good, and plus you can get mods out of it just as the original. So, definitely buy it. If not for the game, do it for the mods. Theres many you can play from, most likely more than the original.

It's hard to pick between going with a "yes" or a "no" for HL2, as it is an extremely impressive piece of work with mostly excellent gameplay that can at times be very tedious. As someone that comes from the Doom 1 and 2 school of FPS gameplay (tank through levels and frag everything that moves with the biggest gun you have), I must say that I was not a fan of the slower portions of the game, such as Water Hazard, Highway 17, and the first portion of Sand Trap. This was mostly due to the vehicle mechanic presenting a frustrating obstacle more often than not, especially due to various irritating "idiosynchracies" of the physics engine in relation to vehicles. This, more often than not, left me stuck on guard rails if I was not careful. I must say that the airboat portion felt much more orthagonal and navigable than the "scout" (dune) buggy, as I feel that too much time was spent trying to locate the exit from an area whilst being assaulted by fast-moving melee enemies in addition to ranged enimies (civil protection). Although the Tau Cannon is mounted to the buggy, it is more of a hinderance than a help should you try to use it, and I may have gotten four kills with it at most. 

That being said, once you finally make it through the blasted "grand theft half-life" portion of the game, things become much more manageable, with standard combat mechanics becoming the norm once again, in addition to the fact that you are now able to dispatch a squad of very sharp, large, alien insects to do your bidding. This is very amusing, and well worth the time spent to get the bug hunt achievment should you want to.

In summary, this is a good title, should you be willing to spend the time to get through the very tedious beginning, with lots of gameplay, amusing humour (should you pay attention to what various NPC's are saying, both to you and to others).

I would also like to note that the soundtrack for HL2 versus the original Half-Life, and Episode One (I have yet to start E2) is rather lacking if you should want an action soundtrack.

Gra klasyk, miła grafika, jeszcze lepsza fizyka oraz rozgrywka nie opierająca się tylko na zastrzel jak najwięcej wrogów. DO tego piękna fabuła. I jaki uśmiech do graczy, pierwsze zetknięcie z wrogami i nasz sojusznik rzuca nam legendarną broń Freemana!!! Tak łom! Mówiąc przy tym, że poprzednio całkiem nieźle sobie z nim radziliśmy. Minusem tej gry jest.... zakończenie, a w zasadzie jego brak. Valve jest głuchy na błagania fanów i niestety nie będzie trzeciej części. Przynajmniej ja zwątpiłem, że zobaczę ją za mojego życia... może moje wnuki się doczekają. No dobra, będąc sprawiedliwym jest zakończenie. Tylko tyle, że otwiera nam tak dużo ścieżek i ewentualnych możliwości co było dalej, że człowieka aż korci by zagrać w następną część. Z czystym sumieniem polecam!!! 9/10 (za brak trzeciej części :P) Jedna z moich ulubionych gier.

MEH! If you havn't played it yet, don't bother. I played it when it come out and just got it on sale for the sake of seeing what I missed(since everyone loves hl2) finished it last night. The story is so hidden and only told through sparce npc conversations it's barrly apparent at all. leaving you wondering from start to finnish what you are doing and why.
It's not terrible but I'd rather replay HL1 for the 10th time than touch HL2 again, it's old move on.

-Arada seni takip eden ve sana yardım eden insanların olması seni o koca dünyada yalnız hissettirmiyor
-Oyunun sonu çok güzel bitirilmiş, ben sonda duygulandım açıkçası

Half Life 2 has had a reputation for being a pretty good game.
And when I started playing it, that reputation still stuck.
Half Life 2 is a fantastic game that was clerly ahead of it's time at the time of it's creation. Most gamers these day(cough cough little kids) have no true taste or interest into games like this. This game has a great story and has managed to keep me reeled in through it's great clips throughout the game. Shooting down flying blade monsters, getting hit by a train, and blowing up a bunch of evil peeps just scratchs the surface. I highly recommend it to fellow gamers.

If you could only play one game in your entire existence on this Earth then play this game. It is a work of pure perfection and I believe you have not lived if you haven't played it. 
Half-Life 2 is a signal player, FPS, action, sci-fi game. It came out in 2004 yet is still an experience no other video game developer has been able to replicate. I find it amazing how this game doesn't have cutscenes or tells you what to do next. 
I strongly urge anyone who has not played this to buy it right now and play it immediantely. Then buy episodes 1 and 2. Then cry over the non-existence of Half-Life 3.

Warning: Watch out for those head-humpers.

By now, most of what can be said about this game has already been said. For someone like me, that doesn't like the fps genre all that much, this game is alluring with it's charming characters, well fleshed out world, and interesting plot. This dystopian landscape is interesting to mave around in, and most of the time there are a lot of details you can find here and there that tells you something about this world you're now in. From a technical standpoint, it is also interesting to see how the graphics of this game from 2004 to a certain degree still holds up today.

Even being a decade or so old, this game still stands the test of time and I can see why gamers loved it so much.

Even by today's standards, the graphics are still brilliant to look at yet run very well on lower-end PCs. And what really makes this game stand out is just how well it gives you a sense of immersion into the plot and setting; it does a great job at making you feel like you're really there and care about what happens.

The game's combat and mechanics are quite good and slick and using the unique weapons such as the gravity gun is quite a blast.

If there's any con to this game, it's that it occasionally feels a little empty, as the player will travel through vast expanses of cityscapes, caves, plains, and deserts and only occasionally run into a hostile encounter. There are also no "bosses" to speak of, and the final encounter isn't particularily challenging. (The additonal chapters however ramp up the action aspect of the game quite a bit compared to the original)

The game can also take quite awhile to complete, and you'll be so immersed in the plot and seeing it through that it'll be hard to put it down.

If you have about 20-30 hours to invest in a game, I recommend giving this one a shot, and seriously doubt you'll regret it (save the fact that the final chapter ends on a cliffhanger, and the sequel promised over 10 years ago has still yet to be released).

Half-Life 2. Czy jest to gra warta uwagi? Cóż według mnie tak ponieważ mimo iż możliwość podnoszenia przedmiotów walających sie po podłodze i Interaktywne guziki itp. są już przestarzałe to gra jest dobra równierz z innych powodów. Mimo niezbyt powalającej grafiki (Lepszej Niż w HL1) gra jest świetna pod wieloma względami np.:
Rzucony przez wroga Granat można podnieść za pomocą Gravity Gun'a i rzucić mu z powrotem. Można go równierz zabić za pomocą beczki a jeśli to zombie to można (Co jest super extra) zabić go nawet piłą! Postacie są genialne tak samo jak fabuła. Co prawda fakt że jak zabijesz kolesia i potem twój przyjacielski NPC przejdzie przez jego ciało to gra nie jest taka zła. Co prawda jeśli chcesz pograć w Multi musisz kupić HL2:Deatchmatch oddzielnie (Ale jeśli w fabułe z kolegami to możesz sobie ściągać Synergy i droga wolna i darmowa) ale nawet jeśli Multi nie ma w grze to naprawde warto ją kupić i zagrać. Polecam ją dla fanów serii i dla całej reszty.

半条命2可以说是个很经典的游戏，我也慕名玩了玩，但是我发现一个非常悬疑的事情，就是玩这个游戏会头晕头痛，起初不知道头痛头晕是为什么，后来慢慢发现是游戏弄的，我查了网上发现也有很多这样的人，网上还说什么3D眩晕症，我觉得那是胡扯，因为我绝对没有3D眩晕症，我玩过很多3D游戏，传送门那么东倒西歪的都不会晕半条命2能晕？何况半条命2游戏里也只是正常W移动，由此这个游戏让我玩玩后就不敢玩了，刚刚进游戏不到3分钟就退了，现在头还难受，所以我才煞费苦心的写这个评论，希望能给想玩和在玩或者已经和我一样头晕难受的人一个提醒。最后，如果夸张的说一句，我怀疑这游戏反人类。。。。
